document.masterDocTitle: Studies of Madagascan Ptiliidae (Coleoptera) 4: The genus Bambara including eight new species and the first account of blindness and aptery in the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Studies of Madagascan Ptiliidae (Coleoptera) 4: The genus Bambara including eight new species and the first account of blindness and aptery in the genus

subSubSection.paragraph:
Habitus Fig. 1 . Length +/- 660 µ. Colour brownish yellow. Antennae length +/- 266 µ. Pronotum length 183 µ min, 196 µ max, 187 µ mean; width 344 µ min, 360 µ max, 353 µ mean; ratio width/length 1.89 . Detached elytron length 410 µ min, 457 µ max, 437 µ mean; width 220 µ min, 239 µ max, 230 µ mean; ratio length/width 1.90 ; Fig. 17 . Ratio mean elytra length/mean pronotum length 2.34 . Mesoventrum
Fig. 11
.
Etymology . Named because of the problem of interpreting the differences in spermathecal shape.

Diagnosis . The shape of the spermatheca. The relatively short distance between the pump and gland insertion points will help to separate this species from other
Bambara
with similar spermathecae. The range of spermathecal shapes suggests that it may be a species group although the consistency in elytral lengths (
Table 2
) and possibility that the spermathecal differences may be the result of parthenogenesis, support the suggestion of a single species.

Type data
: Holotype : ♀. Paratypes : ♀, Ranomafana N.P., sifting, S.
